tn.text: Yahweh tells Moses how to build the worship equipment.
Here "you" refers to Moses and the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

These were projections that looked like ox horns attached to the four corners of the altar. See how you translated "horns" in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:27:01|27:2]]. AT: "You must make its horns"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.
"an altar to burn incense"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you will attach to the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues to tell Moses what the people must do.

The ark is the chest that contains the commandments. This can be stated clearly in the translation. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:26:31|26:33]]. AT: "the chest containing the commandments" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is the lid that sits on top of the ark where the atonement offering was made. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:15|25:17]].

tn.ref: where I will meet with you
tn.text: Here "you" refers to Moses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.
"through all the generations of your descendants." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:12:12|12:14]].
Though the word "you" is addressed to Moses, the instruction is given specifically to Aaron and his descendants as to when and what they are to offer on the altar of incense.
Yahweh continues speaking to Moses.
These were projections that looked like ox horns attached to the four corners of the altar. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:27:01|27:2]].
"through all the generations of your descendants." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:12:12|12:14]].
Possible meanings are 1) "you" refers to just Moses or 2) "you" refers to Moses and the leaders of Israel in future generations when they take a census. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
The leaders only counted the Israelite men.
This can be stated in active form. They counted only the men. AT: "Everyone you count" or "Every man you count" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

"1/2 a shekel of silver." Translators may use a unit of measure that people understand and a round number: "5.5 grams of silver" or "six grams of silver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])

tn.ref: according to the weight of the shekel of the sanctuary
tn.text: There were evidently shekels of more than one weight at the time. This specified which one was to be used.

"20 gerahs." A gerah is a unit that people used for measuring how much something very small weighed. (See:  [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: from twenty years old and up
tn.text: Larger numbers are spoken of as being up or above smaller numbers. AT: "from twenty years old and more" or "who is twenty years old or older" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh continues to tell Moses what the people must do.
Only the men made this offering.

Translators may use a unit of measure that people understand and a round number: "the 5.5 grams of silver" or "the 6 grams of silver." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:11|3:13]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])

tn.ref: It must be a reminder to the Israelites before me, to make atonement for your lives
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "It will remind the Israelites to make atonement for their lives" or 2) "It will remind the Israelites that they have made atonement for their lives."
Here "you" refers to Moses and the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"bowl" or "tub"
This is what the basin would be put on.
This phrase explains what the priests were to use the large bronze basin for.
the altar of sacrifice
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.
"water in the basin"

tn.ref: for Aaron and his descendants throughout their people's generations
tn.text: "for Aaron and all the generations of  his descendants." See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:12:12|12:14]].
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

dried plants that people grind into a powder and put in oil or food to give it a nice smell or flavor. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:03|25:6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

"500 shekels ... 250 shekels." A shekel is about 11 grams. Translators may use units that people know and round numbers: "5.7 kilograms ... 11.4 kilograms" or "six kilograms ... three kilograms" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])
These are sweet spices. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

tn.ref: the weight of the shekel of the sanctuary
tn.text: There were evidently shekels of more than one weight at the time. This specified which one was to be used. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:11|30:13]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])
Translators may use units that people know and round numbers: "3.7 liters" or "four liters"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])
"with these items"
Possible meanings are 1) Moses was to have a perfumer do the work or 2) Moses was to do the work himself the way a perfumer would do it.
a person who is skilled in mixing spices and oils
Yahweh continues speaking to Moses.
Here "you" refers to Moses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

The ark is the chest that contains the commandments. This can be stated clearly in the translation. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:26:31|26:33]]. AT: "the chest containing the commandments."  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"the altar on which offering were burnt"
Yahweh continues speaking to Moses.
This refers to the items listed in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:26|30:26-28]].
"all the generations of your descendants." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:12:12|12:14]].
Yahweh continues telling Moses what Moses must tell the people.

tn.ref: It must not be applied to people's skin
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must not put the anointing oil that is dedicated to Yahweh on a person's skin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"with the same ingredients" or "with the same items"

tn.ref: that person must be cut off from his people
tn.text: The metaphor "cut off" has at least three possible meanings. They can be expressed in active form: 1) "I will no longer consider him to be one of the people of Israel" 2)  "the people of Israel must send him away" or 3) "the people of Israel must kill him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

Yahweh continues to tell Moses what to do. Yahweh gives the commands only to Moses: all instances of "you" are singular. However, the words "blended by a perfumer" might mean that Moses could have the perfumer take the spices, blend them, grind them, and give them to Moses so Moses could put part of the mixture in front of the ark, as in UDB.
These are spices. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

tn.ref: Make it into the form of incense, blended by a perfumer
tn.text: The phrase with "blended" can be translated in active form. AT: "Make it into the form of incense that a perfumer has blended" or "A perfumer must blend it into a kind of incense" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

Possible meanings are 1) Moses was to have a perfumer do the work or 2) Moses was to do the work himself the way a perfumer would do it. See how you translated these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:22|30:25]].
"You will crush it." Here "you" refers to Moses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is plural and refers to Moses and all the people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Yahweh continues to tell Moses what the people must do.
The word "you" here refers to the people of Israel.
"with the same ingredients" or "with the same items." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:32|30:32]].

tn.ref: It must be most holy to you
tn.text: "You must consider it to be most holy"
This is a pleasant smelling liquid a person puts on his or her body.

tn.ref: must be cut off from his people
tn.text: The metaphor "cut off" has at least three possible meanings. They can be expressed in active form: 1) "I will no longer consider him to be one of the people of Israel" 2)  "the people of Israel must send him away" or 3) "the people of Israel must kill him." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:32|30:33]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
